moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4: a standard reaction against the Philidor: Black cannot allow dxe5...
moves.6... a6 7. O-O b5 8. f4: no fear, for b5-b4: we take over the center...
moves.8... O-O 9. Be3 c5 10. Nf5 Bxf5 11. exf5: hard to follow: Black had several better moves...
moves.12. g4: a bit brisky, for the White King: but it works...
moves.12... Nc6: finishing development: apart from solving the threat of Be4...
moves.14. Nd5 c4 15. Be2: White has done enough damage: this is stronger than Be4...
moves.15... Bd8: Black acknowledges the problem: Nxe7+ wins another tempo, and pawn f5 is invulnerable; because Whites' next move, will always be Bg4...
moves.19... Qxc7 20. Qd5+ Kh8: also here, there were better solutions...
moves.21. h5: here Black resigned: White is about to rip open the Black Kings' wing...
